functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

msg.content: Where are the best-selling female rappers from?
Where are the best-selling female rappers from?

function.name: delegate
function.arguments: {"instructions":"Find out the hometowns or origins of the best-selling female rappers."}

functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: Find out the hometowns or origins of the best-selling female rappers.

No page with that title exists. Try searching for one of these similar articles instead:
- List of best-selling female rappers
- List of best-selling female music artists in the United Kingdom
- List of best-selling music artists
- List of highest-grossing concert tours by women
- List of best-selling albums by women
- List of best-selling singles
- List of best-selling albums
- Cardi B discography
- Invasion of Privacy (album)
- The Notorious K.I.M.
msg.name: search

msg.content:
<document>
<title>List of best-selling female rappers</title>
<content>
|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| ![](image)
 | This article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed.*Find sources:* "List of best-selling female rappers" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(August 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*
 |


![](image)Nicki Minaj is the best selling female rapper of all time with over 100 million records sold
This is a following list of the best-selling female rappers of all time, including albums and singles.


Figures for the list only includes pure sales figures and available figures after the 1990s: as of 2010 certifications have been combined with streaming or digital audio sales; in this list only digital sales are counted since most of today artists' pure sales are sold digitally.




## Best-selling female rappers worldwide[edit]




| Artist
 | Country of origin
 | Period active
 | Studio albums
 | Claimed sales
 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Nicki Minaj | Trinidad & Tobago
 | 2003–present
 | 4
 | 100 million[1] |
| Iggy Azalea | Australia
 | 2011–present
 | 3
 | 70 million[2][3][4] |
| Lauryn Hill | United States
 | 1988–present
 | 1
 | 50 million[5] |
| Lil' Kim | United States
 | 1994–present
 | 5
 | 45 million[6] |
| Cardi B | United States
 | 2015–present
 | 1
 | 31 million (singles)[7] |
| Missy Elliott | United States
 | 1991–present
 | 6
 | 29 million[8][9][10] |


## Best-selling female rappers singles[edit]


Sales based on claimed figures and certifications.





| Artist
 | Release year
 | Song
 | Claimed sales
 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Cardi B | 2017
 | "Bodak Yellow"
 | 10 million[11] |
| Iggy Azalea | 2014
 | "Fancy"
 | 9.1 million[12] |
| Nicki Minaj | 2012
 | "Starships"
 | 7.2 million[12] |


## Best-selling female rap albums worldwide[edit]




| Release year
 | Album
 | Artist
 | Claimed sales
 |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1998
 | *The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill* | Lauryn Hill | 20 million[13][14][15] |
| 2010
 | *Pink Friday* | Nicki Minaj | 3.8 million[16] |
| 2014
 | *The Pinkprint* | Nicki Minaj | 3 million[17] |
| 2018
 | *Invasion of Privacy* | Cardi B | 3 million[18] |
| 2012
 | *Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded* | Nicki Minaj | 1.4 million[19] |


## See also[edit]


* List of best-selling girl groups
* List of best-selling albums by women


## References[edit]


1. **^** "Rapper Nicki Minaj's father killed in hit-and-run". *The New Zealand Herald*. February 15, 2021. Retrieved February 15, 2021.
2. **^** Mark, David (January 18, 2022). "'Fancy' Rapper Iggy Azalea Quits Music, Asks $6.2 Million for Recently Acquired Suburban Home". *Dirt*. Retrieved April 16, 2023.
3. **^** "Australian rapper Iggy Azalea headlining Croatia's Sea Star festival". *CroatiaWeek*. March 11, 2022. Retrieved April 16, 2023.
4. **^** "Superstar Iggy Azalea Is Coming to Sea Star Festival!". *SeaStarFestival*. March 11, 2022. Retrieved April 16, 2023.
5. **^** Brandle, Lars (April 24, 2013). "Lauryn Hill Sets the Record Straight on her Finances, Admits New Music is in the Pipeline". *Billboard*. Retrieved July 8, 2022.
6. **^** Skelton, Eric (August 1, 2018). "Premiere: Lil' Kim Lives a Life of Luxury in "Nasty One" Video". *Complex*. Retrieved July 8, 2022.
7. **^** Maurice Cassidy (February 1, 2021). "How Much Did Cardi B And Bruno Mars Spend On Their 'Please Me' Music Video?". *The Things*. Retrieved August 14, 2022.
8. **^** Sun, Rebecca (2017-08-09). "Missy Elliott Signs With WME: Exclusive". *Billboard*. Retrieved 2023-02-07.
9. **^** Khari (February 2, 2015). "Missy Elliott Crushed The Superbowl & Now Everyone Is Ready for Her Comeback". *The Source*. The Northstar Group. Archived from the original on February 15, 2015. Retrieved March 15, 2015.
10. **^** Platon, Adelle (2016-06-14). "Missy Elliott Named Honoree at VH1 Hip Hop Honors: Exclusive". *Billboard*. Retrieved 2023-02-07.
11. **^** Daniels, Karu F. (March 10, 2021). "Cardi B has made history again, as breakthrough 'Bodak Yellow' sells more than 10 million copies". *New York Daily News*. Retrieved July 8, 2022.
12. ^ ***a*** ***b*** "The Global Bestsellers of 2012" (PDF). International Federation of the Phonographic Industry. Archived from the original on April 9, 2013. Retrieved December 23, 2014.`{{cite web}}`: CS1 maint: unfit URL (link)
13. **^** "CERTIFIED CLASSICS IN COLLABORATION WITH SPOTIFY CELEBRATES 20 YEARS OF THE ICONIC THE MISEDUCATION OF LAURYN HILL ALBUM WITH DEAR MS. HILL & DISSECT MINI SERIES – Sony Music Canada". *www.sonymusic.ca*. Archived from the original on January 19, 2021. Retrieved January 7, 2021.
14. **^** "The Selling of 'The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill'". *www.okayplayer.com*. Retrieved January 7, 2021.
15. **^** "First female rapper to reach RIAA Diamond status". *Guinness World Records*. Retrieved 2023-04-26.
16. **^** Trentz Fitzgerald (April 14, 2022). "Nicki Minaj Performs 'Roman Reloaded' Concert on BET's 106 & Park". *Pop Crush*. Archived from the original on July 22, 2017. Retrieved August 14, 2022.
17. **^** Zach Frydenlund (December 16, 2015). "People Didn't Believe Nicki Minaj's 'The Pinkprint' Sold Three Million Copies So She Flexed on Them". *Complex*. Archived from the original on October 16, 2021. Retrieved August 14, 2022.
18. **^** Jessica Napoli (September 16, 2020). "What is Cardi B's net worth?". *yahoo.com*. Retrieved August 14, 2022.
19. **^** "The Global Bestsellers of 2012" (PDF). International Federation of the Phonographic Industry. Archived from the original (PDF) on April 9, 2013.

</content>
</document>
msg.name: search

msg.content:
Here are the hometowns or origins of some of the best-selling female rappers:

1. Nicki Minaj - Trinidad & Tobago
2. Iggy Azalea - Australia
3. Lauryn Hill - United States
4. Lil' Kim - United States
5. Cardi B - United States
6. Missy Elliott - United States

These are the countries of origin for the mentioned best-selling female rappers.
